DataElement.preferredName: Female Fertility Symptom Past Month Severity Name
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Text term to represent the degree of a fertility symptom experienced by a woman. [Manually-curated]

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Female Fertility Symptom Past Month Severity
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: In zoology, denoting the sex that bears the young or the ovum._The capacity to conceive or to induce conception. It may refer to either the male or female._An indication that a person has a condition or disease.  Some examples of symptoms are headache, fever, fatigue, nausea, vomiting, and pain._Past; before the present time._One of the 12 divisions of a year as determined by a calendar.  It corresponds to the unit of time of approximately to one cycle of the moon's phases, about 30 days or 4 weeks._The number of occurrences of something within a given time period. (NCI)_Severity; used of the degree of something undesirable e.g. pain or weather.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: In zoology, denoting the sex that bears the young or the ovum.:The capacity to conceive or to induce conception. It may refer to either the male or female.

Concepts.definition: A person who belongs to the sex that normally produces ova. The term is used to indicate biological sex distinctions, or cultural gender role distinctions, or both.
The ability of an individual to produce offspring.

Property.preferredDefinition: An indication that a person has a condition or disease.  Some examples of symptoms are headache, fever, fatigue, nausea, vomiting, and pain.:Past; before the present time.:One of the 12 divisions of a year as determined by a calendar.  It corresponds to the unit of time of approximately to one cycle of the moon's phases, about 30 days or 4 weeks.:Severity; used of the degree of something undesirable e.g. pain or weather.

Concepts.definition: Subjective evidence of disease perceived by the patient.
One of the 12 divisions of a year as determined by a calendar. It corresponds to the unit of time of approximately to one cycle of the moon's phases, about 30 days or 4 weeks.
Used of the degree of something undesirable e.g. pain or weather; also, strictness.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the patient's ability to conceive or nurse offspring and/or their current reproductive status.

ValueDomain.preferredName: Severity/Intensity Scale for Adverse Events Name
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: A scale that defines the degree or state of disease existing in a patient as a result of the occurance of an adverse event._The words or language units by which a thing is known.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A type of adverse event that requires intensive therapeutic intervention. The event interrupts usual activities of daily living, or significantly affects clinical status. The event possesses a significant risk of harm to the research participant and hospitalization may be required.:C41340:CDISC

A type of adverse event that is usually alleviated with additional specific therapeutic intervention. The event interferes with usual activities of daily living, causing discomfort but poses no significant or permanent risk of harm to the research participant.:C41339:CDISC

A type of adverse event that is usually transient and may require only minimal treatment or therapeutic intervention. The event does not generally interfere with usual activities of daily living.:C41338:CDISC

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: any unfavorable symptoms, signs, or disease temporally associated with the use of a medical treatment or procedure that may or may not be considered related to the medical treatment or procedure

RepresentationTerm.preferredName: Severity/Intensity Scale for Adverse Events Name
RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: No Value Exists:The words or language units by which a thing is known.

Concepts.definition: A scale that defines the degree or state of disease existing in a patient as a result of the occurrence of an adverse event.
The words or language units by which a thing is known.

ValueDomain.changeDescription: Some PVs in the CDE have a workaround with :Concept Number:Source (when applicable) to capture the correct term type and definition from NCIt. Moved from Test context to the NCIP.

DataElement.changeDescription: Curated to support Northwestern University adoption of C3D
